compiler
Class TextFile

java.lang.Object
  compiler.TextFile

public class TextFile
extends java.lang.Object

Wrapper class that is used to pull a text file from hard disk into memory. The TextFile class gives functionality to that text file in memory so that it can be accessed and written to.

Author:
Michael Pinnegar

Field Summary
private  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> body
          The main storage body for each string that represents the text file in memory
private  int posPointer
          The horizontal depth into a string of the body array
private  int rowPointer
          The vertical depth down the rows of strings in the body array

stripCommentsAndWhiteSpace

public void stripCommentsAndWhiteSpace()
Removes all comments from a textFile object.

insertLine

public void insertLine(int row,
                       java.lang.String input)
Inserts a line of text at the specified row

Parameters:
row - specified row
input - line of text

getNonWSToken

public Token getNonWSToken(boolean lookAhead)
Returns the next non-whitespace Token from the file. The token is still there, but the lookAhead boolean determines of the internal pointer is incremented past it.

Parameters:
lookAhead - If true, token is left in the textfile
Returns:
next non-whitespace token .Null if the textfile is empty.

getToken

public Token getToken(boolean isLookAhead)
Fetches the next Token from the textFile. Will return white space tokens. If lookAhead is true, the textfile's internal pointers are left unchanged, allowing the same token to be retrieved multiple times.

Parameters:
isLookAhead - If true, an internal pointer is not incremented past the token.
Returns:
The next token in the text file. Null if the textfile is empty.

getLine

public java.lang.String getLine()
Returns the remaining text from the pointer's position to the end of the line. Increments the pointer to the next line afterwards.

Returns:
Returns the remaining text to the end of the line without any carriage return.

addToRow

public void addToRow(int amount)
Adds some amount to the row counter.

Parameters:
amount -

setRow

public void setRow(int position)
Set the row counter to a position indicated by amount.

Parameters:
amount -

write

public void write(java.lang.String outputFilename)
           throws java.io.IOException
Writes the textfile to disk, line by line, starting from the first line regardless of the pointer's position.

Parameters:
outputFilename - Name given to the file to be written to disk
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Can not write file to disk

input

public void input(java.lang.String entry)
Creates a new line of text at the end of the textfile.

Parameters:
entry - Text to be appended to the end of the textfile

display

public void display()
Prints the textfile line by line to the console.

reset

public void reset()
Moves the pointer back to the very beginning of the textfile

isEndOfFile

public boolean isEndOfFile()
Checks to see if the pointer is pointing at the end of file

Returns:
True if the pointer is at the last line, last spot of the file
